item.title: Degraded and Unavailable Servers
item.description:
Dec 15, 16:01 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. Users might see errors starting a video stream.

Dec 15, 15:48 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue. Users might see errors starting a video stream.

Dec 15, 15:47 PST
Investigating - We are working to correct an issue that is causing some servers to be degraded and unavailable.

item.title: We're investigating an elevated error rate which is causing API calls to fail
item.description:
Dec 15, 15:25 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Dec 15, 14:45 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Dec 15, 14:05 PST
Identified - We're aware of an issue where API requests are failing. We believe this to be an upstream issue, tracked here: https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/z07jsxj4vvzv

item.title: Some servers lagging/unavailable
item.description:
Dec 15, 14:37 PST
Resolved - The unavailable servers should be recovered. The other incident may still be causing impact to some users.

Dec 15, 13:32 PST
Investigating - We are investigating a small portion of discord servers being unavailable and/or lagging

item.title: Elevated API Latency
item.description:
Dec 13, 06:37 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved

Dec 13, 06:14 PST
Monitoring - Latency is back to normal, we are monitoring recovery.

Dec 13, 06:03 PST
Identified - We have identified the issue are are addressing it now

Dec 13, 05:39 PST
Investigating - We are investigating elevated API latency

item.title: Attachments Broken on Android
item.description:
Dec 8, 13:51 PST
Resolved - We have identified and put out a fix for the attachment upload bug. The fix requires a mobile app update. If you continue to experience issues, please check for application updates and restart your Discord application.

Dec 8, 12:01 PST
Identified - We are still working on the issue with the Android client (versions 206 and 207) failing to upload attachments. At this time, updating your client to the latest 206 and 207 will not fix the issue.

Dec 8, 11:22 PST
Monitoring - Attachment uploads from a recent version of the Android client (206.16, 207.23) are broken. Updating to the newest version of the app should solve the issue.

item.title: Elevated Clients Crashes and Partial Connection Issue
item.description:
Nov 15, 18:25 PST
Resolved - Fix has been fully rolled out. If you believe your client is still being impacted, restart your client and it should correct the issue.

Nov 15, 18:05 PST
Monitoring - Fix has been deployed, additional mitigations will be required but the client crash rate has returned to nominal levels.

Nov 15, 17:46 PST
Update - Oncall Engineering is applying a mitigation for this issue.

Nov 15, 17:27 PST
Identified - An issue has been identified that is causing increased client crashes and in some cases clients that may appear to be connected but are not receiving realtime updates.

Oncall Engineering is working to address this issue.

item.title: Errors logging in to Discord
item.description:
Nov 10, 18:01 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 10, 16:19 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Nov 10, 16:10 PST
Identified - We have identified the issue and are applying a fix.

Nov 10, 15:40 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating an issue that may cause some login attempts to fail.

item.title: Voice connection issues in US Central
item.description:
Nov 10, 13:10 PST
Resolved - We have confirmed that the vendor's fix has lead to connection success recovery on our side. This incident is resolved.

Nov 10, 13:00 PST
Monitoring - We are beginning to see recovery in our monitoring and are continuing to watch progress.

Nov 10, 12:56 PST
Update - Unfortunately our previous identification of the issue did not fix the problem. Our vendor believes they have identified the issue and are implementing a fix, so we hope to see improvement soon.

Nov 10, 10:50 PST
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix. In the meantime we have provisioned capacity on a secondary provider in us-central.
This should help users in us-central connect to voice.

Nov 10, 09:12 PST
Identified - We've identified an unexpected IP address change made by one of our providers, and are making changes on our end to accommodate. We hope the voice connectivity issues will be resolved shortly.

Nov 9, 22:56 PST
Update - We are continuing to investigate the issue with our infrastructure providers.

Nov 9, 18:50 PST
Investigating - We are investigating voice connection issues in us central. So far it seems to be isolated to a small number of ISPs.

item.title: Elevated API Latency and Errors
item.description:
Nov 7, 05:20 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Nov 7, 05:09 PST
Monitoring - The fix is having the desired impact and we are monitoring recovery now.

Nov 7, 05:07 PST
Identified - We have identified an autoscaling issue with our API nodes, we are working around this limit now.

Nov 7, 04:13 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue

item.title: Cannot create or join servers.
item.description:
Nov 6, 15:41 PST
Resolved - API has been fully rolled back.

Nov 6, 15:31 PST
Identified - And probably a few other things.

We're currently investigating the issue and rolling back an API deploy.

item.title: Elevated latency and errors
item.description:
Nov 6, 12:00 PST
Resolved - Traffic and latency are fully restored, Discord is fully operational.

The underlying issue was due to an operation we performed on our authentication database cluster which resulted in too much reduced capacity in the database cluster. We performed some load shedding to enable some traffic to recover, but due to the nature of this cluster's topology and the incident, only about 50% of our userbase was able to get back online in the interim and we had to wait for the maintenance to complete on the impacted database nodes before we were able to fully restore the service.

We'll be following up internally with a postmortem and will plan to publish a public blog post describing the incident and our followups to ensure that this issue cannot recur. Our goal is that Discord just works when you need it; we know many of you (and all of us!) rely on Discord. Please accept our apologies and thank you for your patience today as we worked through this incident.

Nov 6, 11:45 PST
Monitoring - The cluster is healthy and we are now seeing major recovery of users and latency, but it will take another 5-10 minutes for all users to come online. We are continuing to be online and monitor through the recovery.

Nov 6, 11:43 PST
Update - The databases that were impacted have come back online and we are beginning to see recovery of the graphs on the authentication service. We will continue to apply rate limits to the service until every user is back online and latency has recovered.

Nov 6, 11:36 PST
Update - We are continuing to bring users online as we are able, while we balance bringing back online some of the impacted database nodes. We appreciate your patience while we work through this.

The underlying issue was an operation the team performed to upgrade some of the database nodes. We will conduct a full postmortem analysis to understand what went wrong in the operation, but at the moment we are fully focused on bringing the service back online.

Nov 6, 11:26 PST
Update - We have approximately 50% of users back in and using Discord, but latency is still elevated. If you still aren't able to log in, you should be able to get in in the near future. Latency will continue to be elevated until we are able to address the underlying database issue limiting throughput.

Nov 6, 11:16 PST
Update - We are beginning to allow traffic back into the service and seeing users reconnecting, but we are applying a rate limit so that we can ramp traffic up at a rate that doesn't overwhelm the authentication service.

Nov 6, 11:08 PST
Identified - We have identified the underlying issue impacting our authentication service and we are working to resolve it now. We have the relevant teams online and engaged in our incident response process.

Nov 6, 10:57 PST
Investigating - We are aware of an issue impacting Discord latency and errors. The team is online and investigating now.

Resolved - The incident has been resolved.

item.title: Third Party Outage
item.description:
Oct 30, 13:39 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Oct 30, 13:21 PDT
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Oct 30, 13:19 PDT
Investigating - We're experiencing an outage from a third party service that is affecting performance on Activities.

item.title: Color issues while screensharing on Windows with Nvidia Graphics Card
item.description:
Oct 27, 17:32 PDT
Resolved - This issue is still affecting a small number of users, who are advised to roll back their nvidia driver.

Find more details here:
https://support.discord.com/hc/en-us/articles/18621944634391

Oct 20, 18:02 PDT
Investigating - We are investigating a stream discoloration issue happening while screensharing. So far it looks like a compatibility issue between us and the latest nvidia driver (545.84). We are working with Nvidia on a fix.
Downgrading your Nvidia driver version to version 537.58 or below should resolve the issue. You can download the appropriate Nvidia driver for you system here: https://www.nvidia.com/download/find.aspx
Some instructions on how to rollback your driver installation: https://www.nvidia.com/en-us/drivers/driver-rollback/

item.title: Windows Overlay not working for some users
item.description:
Oct 27, 15:41 PDT
Resolved - The fix has been fully rolled out. Please update to version 1.0.9021.

Oct 27, 10:59 PDT
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and has been partially rolled out.

Oct 26, 12:53 PDT
Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

Resolved - The issue has been resolved.

Oct 17, 10:18 PDT

item.title: Discord MacOS Desktop Client Crashing
item.description:
Oct 5, 12:12 PDT
Resolved - The new version, 0.0.280, is available. If you switched to use Rosetta with the bad version, it's now safe to update and then turn off Rosetta.

If you downloaded the bad version and the app is still crashing for you, please download the update from the website (https://discord.com/api/download?platform=osx).

Oct 5, 10:59 PDT
Update - If you've downloaded the bad version, please re-download from the website (https://discord.com/api/download?platform=osx)!

Oct 5, 10:44 PDT
Identified - We are aware of an issue causing the newest version of the Discord MacOS desktop client to crash and are working on a fix.
